    • Method Detail

      • calculateDiff

        public static IndexValueDiff calculateDiff(com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<java.lang.String,Indexer<?>> indexNameToIndexers,
                                           java.lang.Object oldValue,
                                           java.lang.Object newValue)
        Calculates a diff between the indexed values of the given oldValue and newValue.
        Parameters:
        indexNameToIndexers - A mapping from index names to indexers. This method will attempt to resolve the index value(s) for all index names. May be empty, in which case the resulting diff will also be empty. Must not be null.
        oldValue - The old (previous) value object to analyze. May be null to indicate that the newValue is an addition.
        newValue - The new value object to analyze. May be null to indicate that the oldValue was deleted.
        Returns:
        The diff between the old and new index values. Never null, may be empty.

      • getIndexedValuesForObject

        public static com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getIndexedValuesForObject(com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<java.lang.String,Indexer<?>> indexNameToIndexers,
                                                                                                                 java.lang.Object object)
        Returns the indexed values for the given object.
        Parameters:
        indexNameToIndexers - A multimap from index name to indexers. Must not be null, may be empty, in which case the resulting multimap will be empty.
        object - The object to get the index values for. May be null, in which case the resulting multimap will be empty.
        Returns:
        The mapping from index name to indexed values. May be empty, but never null.

      • getIndexedValuesForObject

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> getIndexedValuesForObject(java.util.Set<Indexer<?>> indexers,
                                                                        java.lang.Object object)
        Returns the indexed values for the given object.
        Parameters:
        indexers - The set of indexers to run on the object. Must not be null. Only one of the indexers may produce an index value, otherwise an indexer conflict occurs. Usually, all of these indexers correspond to the same index name.
        object - The object to index. May be null, which results in the empty set as the output.
        Returns:
        An immutable set, containing the index values calculated by running the given indexers on the given object. May be empty, but never null.

      • isValidIndexValue

        public static boolean isValidIndexValue(java.lang.Object obj)
